arts.ttl: Alessandro Nesta: ‘Maldini needed a reset – When he came on he made the difference’
arts.sum: After Monza’s 1-1 draw in the Lombardy Derby against Como, head coach Alessandro Nesta shared his thoughts on the match and the performance of his players during a post-game press conference. Nesta began by analyzing the game, stating, “I believe the match was divided into two halves: a complicated first half for us where we created little. The game changed in the second half when they pulled back a bit, and in the final minutes, anything could have happened. It’s a good point; we must not lose a derby. arts.ttl: Cesc Fabregas: ‘We’re too nice, we need to commit more fouls’
arts.sum: Following the Lombardy Derby between Como and Monza, which ended in a 1-1 draw, Como’s head coach Cesc Fabregas shared his thoughts on the match and the team’s performance. The game, part of the 14th round of Serie A, showcased the struggles both teams face as they fight to avoid relegation. Fabregas began by discussing the challenges his team encountered during the match. “Today we didn’t have much depth on the bench. We are in a bit of a difficult moment with injuries,” he noted. arts.ttl: Serie A | Como 1-1 Monza: Match Report
arts.sum: Como and Monza continue to struggle in the relegation zone following a fiercely contested Lombardy Derby, where both teams had significant opportunities to secure a late victory. The match highlighted the desperation of both sides, each fighting to escape the bottom three of the Serie A table. The encounter was characterized by its intensity, with Como and Monza separated by just one point in the standings. Como faced challenges with key players missing due to injuries and suspensions, including Alberto Dossena, while Monza also dealt with absences, including Armando Izzo and Matteo Pessina. arts.ttl: Como vs. Monza, a fight for survival
arts.sum: Monza has won only one of their last 22 Serie A matches (D9 L12) - a 3-0 victory at Hellas Verona last October - and during this period (30th matchday of last season), Monza is the team that has earned the fewest points (only 12) among the clubs that have been in both of the last two seasons` leagues. Milan Djuric has scored 12 headed goals in Serie A, including the most recent one against Torino; in the last four seasons, among players currently active in the big five European leagues, only Robert Lewandowski (13), Erling Haaland (14), and Harry Kane (23) have scored more headers than the Monza forward.

arts.ttl: Como face tough test against Monza, Fabregas: “We need to win”
arts.sum: Como are preparing for a crucial match against Monza following their recent home defeat to Fiorentina. Manager Cesc Fabregas addressed the media in a pre-match press conference, providing updates on player availability and sharing his thoughts on the upcoming fixture. Fabregas began by discussing the team’s injury situation: “Kempf will be available tomorrow, while we’re still evaluating whether to start Van der Brempt or not – I’ll speak with him. arts.ttl: Nesta: Monza concerned but not scared ahead of Como derby
arts.sum: Monza manager Alessandro Nesta addressed the media ahead of their upcoming derby match against Como. The team is coming off a draw with Torino and looking to secure another positive result in what Nesta describes as a “special match” for the fans. Reflecting on the team’s recent performance and mindset, Nesta stated, “Personally, I don’t see a scared team, but a bit worried. arts.ttl: Serie A | Como v Monza: Match Preview
arts.sum: Como and Monza are set to clash at Stadio Sinigaglia this Saturday in a crucial Serie A matchup as both teams aim to break their winless streaks. With Como having not won in their last seven matches and Monza’s last victory dating back to October, the stakes are high for both local rivals. Como’s recent form has been disheartening, highlighted by a 2-0 defeat at home against Fiorentina last week. Since their return to Serie A, the team has only managed two victories, both occurring in late September. arts.sum: Carlos Soler took time to settle after arriving at West Ham in the summer but he now starting to show what he is capable of as he tries to follow in the footsteps of his idols
